analytic.title: The Lament on Tripoli by Solomon of Ašluḥ (Sulayman al-Ašlūḥī): Its Historical and Cultural Character

monogr.title: East and West in the Medieval Eastern Mediterranean III: Antioch from the Byzantine Reconquest until the End of the Crusader Principality. Acta of the Congress held at Hernen Castle (the Netherlands) in May 2009

body.bibl: Sepmeijer, Floris, and Krijna Nelly Ciggaar. “The Lament on Tripoli by Solomon of Ašluḥ (Sulayman al-Ašlūḥī): Its Historical and Cultural Character.” In East and West in the Medieval Eastern Mediterranean III: Antioch from the Byzantine Reconquest until the End of the Crusader Principality. Acta of the Congress Held at Hernen Castle (the Netherlands) in May 2009, edited by Krijna Nelly Ciggaar and Victoria van Aalst, 9–36. Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta 269. Leuven: Peeters, 2018.

Floris Sepmeijer and Krijna Nelly Ciggaar, The Lament on Tripoli by Solomon of Ašluḥ (Sulayman al-Ašlūḥī): Its Historical and Cultural Character,” in East and West in the Medieval Eastern Mediterranean III: Antioch from the Byzantine Reconquest until the End of the Crusader Principality. Acta of the Congress Held at Hernen Castle (the Netherlands) in May 2009, ed. Krijna Nelly Ciggaar and Victoria van Aalst, Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta 269 (Leuven: Peeters, 2018), 9–36.
